Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus import re print('=== SEARCHING FOR 1877-1878 FOUR-VOLUME EDITION PUBLISHER ===') print('Title: The History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace: 1816-1846') print('Author: Harriet Martineau') print('Target: 1877-1878 four-volume edition publisher') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for the 1877-1878 four-volume edition search_queries = [ 'Harriet Martineau "History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" 1877 1878 four volumes publisher', 'Martineau 1877 1878 edition "History England Thirty Years Peace" publisher', '"History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" Martineau 1877 four volume', 'Harriet Martineau 1877 1878 "Thirty Years Peace" four volumes', 'Martineau "History England" 1877 1878 four volume edition publisher', '"Thirty Years Peace 1816-1846" Martineau 1877 1878 publisher', 'Harriet Martineau 1877 four volume History England publisher', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Macmillan', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Longmans', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Smith Elder' ] # Known 19th century publishers who commonly produced multi-volume historical works known_publishers_1870s = [ 'Macmillan', 'Macmillan and Co', 'Macmillan & Co', 'Longmans', 'Longmans Green', 'Longmans, Green, and Co', 'Smith Elder', 'Smith, Elder & Co', 'Smith, Elder and Co', 'George Routledge', 'Routledge', 'George Routledge and Sons', 'John Murray', 'Murray', 'Chapman and Hall', 'Chapman & Hall', 'Blackwood', 'William Blackwood', 'Blackwood and Sons', 'Cassell', 'Cassell & Company', 'Cassell, Petter & Galpin', 'Ward Lock', 'Ward, Lock & Co', 'Frederick Warne', 'Sampson Low', 'Sampson Low, Marston', 'Henry S. King', 'Kegan Paul', 'Kegan Paul, Trench & Co', 'Rivingtons' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR 1877-1878 EDITION ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') search_results = {} # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Cache-Control': 'no-cache' } # Function to perform search and analyze results - FIXED QUOTE ESCAPING ISSUE def perform_search(query, search_index): search_base_url = 'https://html.duckduckgo.com/html/' print(f'\n--- SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: params = {'q': query} response = requests.get(search_base_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save raw HTML for analysis - FIXED filename generation to avoid quote conflicts clean_query = query.replace(' ', '_').replace('"', '').replace("'", '').replace(':', '').replace('?', '') filename = f'martineau_1877_search_{search_index:02d}_{clean_query[:50]}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Parse for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links with publisher information result_links = [] for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') text = link.get_text().strip() # Filter for highly relevant results if href and text and len(text) > 15: text_lower = text.lower() relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for 1877-1878 four-volume edition high_value_terms = [ ('1877', 4), ('1878', 4), ('four volume', 3), ('four volumes', 3), ('4 volume', 3), ('4 volumes', 3), ('martineau', 3), ('history of england', 2), ('thirty years peace', 2), ('1816-1846', 2), ('1816 1846', 2), ('publisher', 2), ('published', 2), ('edition', 2), ('reprint', 2) ] # Publisher-specific terms with higher scores for known 1870s publishers publisher_terms = [] for pub in known_publishers_1870s: publisher_terms.append((pub.lower(), 4)) # Calculate relevance score for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_terms: if term in text_lower: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'hathitrust.org', 'archive.org', 'books.google.com']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['amazon.com', 'abebooks.com', 'goodreads.com']): relevance_score += 2 if relevance_score >= 4: # Only include highly relevant results result_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': text[:400], # Longer text for better analysis 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) # Sort by relevance score result_links.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'html_file': filepath, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'relevant_links': result_links[:20], # Top 20 most relevant 'total_links_found': len(result_links) } print(f'Found {len(result_links)} highly relevant links') if result_links: print('Top results:') for i, link in enumerate(result_links[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {link["relevance_score"]}: {link["text"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting return True else: print(f'Failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') return False except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') return False # Perform all searches print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES ===') successful_searches = 0 for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): if perform_search(query, i): successful_searches += 1 # Brief pause between searches if i < len(search_queries): time.sleep(1) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR 1877-1878 PUBLISHER ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') # Compile and analyze all findings high_priority_findings = [] all_publishers_mentioned = set() publisher_frequency = {} print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR 1877-1878 PUBLISHER PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant links: {results["total_links_found"]}') for link in results['relevant_links']: # Check for 1877/1878 and publisher combinations text_lower = link['text'].lower() # Check for year mentions (1877 or 1878) has_target_years = any(year in text_lower for year in ['1877', '1878']) # Check for four-volume mentions has_four_volumes = any(term in text_lower for term in ['four volume', 'four volumes', '4 volume', '4 volumes', 'vol. i', 'vol. ii', 'vol. iii', 'vol. iv']) if has_target_years and any(pub.lower() in text_lower for pub in known_publishers_1870s): # This is a high-priority finding matching_publishers = [pub for pub in known_publishers_1870s if pub.lower() in text_lower] priority_level = 'VERY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Publisher' if has_four_volumes: priority_level = 'EXTREMELY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Four Volumes + Publisher' high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'publishers_mentioned': matching_publishers, 'priority': priority_level, 'has_target_years': has_target_years, 'has_four_volumes': has_four_volumes }) # Track publisher frequency for pub in matching_publishers: publisher_frequency[pub] = publisher_frequency.get(pub, 0) + 1 all_publishers_mentioned.add(pub) print(f' üéØ {priority_level}: {matching_publishers}') elif has_target_years: # Contains 1877/1878 but may have publisher info we need to extract priority_level = 'HIGH - Contains 1877/1878' if has_four_volumes: priority_level = 'VERY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Four Volumes' high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'publishers_mentioned': [], 'priority': priority_level, 'has_target_years': has_target_years, 'has_four_volumes': has_four_volumes }) print(f' üìç {priority_level}') # Track any publisher mentions regardless of year for pub in known_publishers_1870s: if pub.lower() in text_lower: all_publishers_mentioned.add(pub) publisher_frequency[pub] = publisher_frequency.get(pub, 0) + 1 print(f'\n=== STEP 3: PUBLISHER FREQUENCY ANALYSIS ===') print(f'Total unique publishers mentioned: {len(all_publishers_mentioned)}') print(f'High-priority findings (1877/1878 + publisher): {len([f for f in high_priority_findings if "publisher" in f["priority"].lower()])}') if publisher_frequency: print('\nPublisher mention frequency:') sorted_publishers = sorted(publisher_frequency.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for pub, count in sorted_publishers: print(f' {pub}: {count} mentions') else: print('\nNo specific publishers identified in search results') print(f'\n=== STEP 4: DETAILED ANALYSIS OF HIGH-PRIORITY FINDINGS ===') if high_priority_findings: # Sort by priority and score priority_order = { 'EXTREMELY HIGH': 5, 'VERY HIGH': 4, 'HIGH': 3, 'MEDIUM': 2, 'LOW': 1 } def get_priority_score(finding): priority = finding['priority'] for key, score in priority_order.items(): if key in priority: return score return 0 high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (get_priority_score(x), x['score']), reverse=True) print(f'\nAnalyzing {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings:') for i, finding in enumerate(high_priority_findings[:15], 1): # Top 15 findings print(f'\nüîç FINDING {i} - {finding["priority"]} (Score: {finding["score"]})') print(f'Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f'Publishers: {finding["publishers_mentioned"] if finding["publishers_mentioned"] else "None explicitly identified"}') print(f'Has 1877/1878: {finding["has_target_years"]}') print(f'Has four volumes: {finding["has_four_volumes"]}') print(f'URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f'Text: {finding["text"][:500]}...') print('-' * 120) # If this is an extremely high priority finding, mark for investigation if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in finding['priority']: print(f' ‚≠ê CRITICAL FOR INVESTIGATION: {finding["url"]}') else: print('\n‚ö† No high-priority findings identified') print('This suggests the 1877-1878 four-volume edition may be rare or from a smaller publisher') print(f'\n=== STEP 5: SEARCHING SPECIFIC LIBRARY CATALOGS ===') # Try to search WorldCat and HathiTrust specifically library_search_queries = [ 'Martineau "History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" 1877', 'Harriet Martineau "Thirty Years Peace" 1877 1878 four volumes', 'Martineau "History England" 1877 four volume' ] library_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(library_search_queries, 1): print(f'\n--- LIBRARY CATALOG SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') # Try WorldCat search try: worldcat_url = f'https://www.worldcat.org/search?q={quote_plus(query)}&qt=results_page' response = requests.get(worldcat_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'WorldCat Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save WorldCat response filename = f'worldcat_martineau_1877_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved WorldCat: {filepath}') # Parse for bibliographic information soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for publication information text_content = soup.get_text().lower() # Check for 1877/1878 and publisher information if ('1877' in text_content or '1878' in text_content) and 'martineau' in text_content: print('‚úì Found relevant WorldCat entries with 1877/1878 + Martineau') # Look for publisher information in the text for pub in known_publishers_1870s: if pub.lower() in text_content: print(f' üìö PUBLISHER FOUND IN WORLDCAT: {pub}') library_results.append({ 'source': 'WorldCat', 'query': query, 'publisher': pub, 'file': filepath }) else: print('- No relevant 1877/1878 Martineau entries found') time.sleep(3) # Longer pause for library catalogs except Exception as e: print(f'Error with WorldCat search: {str(e)}') print(f'\n=== STEP 6: ANALYZING EXISTING WORKSPACE FILES ===') # Check if there are any existing files that might contain relevant information workspace_files = [f for f in os.listdir('workspace') if f.endswith('.html') or f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} existing files to analyze') # Look for files that might contain 1877/1878 or Martineau information relevant_existing_files = [] for filename in workspace_files: filename_lower = filename.lower() if any(term in filename_lower for term in ['martineau', '1877', '1878', 'history', 'england']): relevant_existing_files.append(filename) if relevant_existing_files: print(f'\nFound {len(relevant_existing_files)} potentially relevant existing files:') for filename in relevant_existing_files[:10]: # Check first 10 files print(f'\n--- ANALYZING EXISTING FILE: {filename} ---') filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read().lower() # Check for 1877/1878 and publisher information has_1877_1878 = '1877' in content or '1878' in content has_martineau = 'martineau' in content has_history_england = 'history of england' in content or 'thirty years peace' in content if has_1877_1878 and has_martineau: print(f'‚úì Contains 1877/1878 + Martineau') # Look for publisher information found_publishers = [] for pub in known_publishers_1870s: if pub.lower() in content: found_publishers.append(pub) if found_publishers: print(f' üìö PUBLISHERS FOUND: {found_publishers}') # Try to find specific context around 1877/1878 and publishers if filename.endswith('.html'): soup = BeautifulSoup(content, 'html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() else: text_content = content # Find sentences containing both year and publisher lines = text_content.split('\n') for line in lines: line_lower = line.lower() if ('1877' in line_lower or '1878' in line_lower) and any(pub.lower() in line_lower for pub in found_publishers): matching_pubs = [pub for pub in found_publishers if pub.lower() in line_lower] print(f' üéØ CONTEXT: {matching_pubs[0]} - {line.strip()[:200]}...') break else: print(' - No known publishers found') else: print('- Not relevant (missing 1877/1878 or Martineau)') except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading {filename}: {str(e)}') else: print('\nNo relevant existing files found') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Identify publisher of 1877-1878 four-volume edition of Martineau\'s History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace', 'book_details': { 'title': 'The History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace: 1816-1846', 'author': 'Harriet Martineau', 'target_edition': '1877-1878 four-volume edition', 'period_covered': '1816-1846' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(r['relevant_links']) for r in search_results.values()), 'library_catalog_searches': len(library_search_queries) }, 'publisher_analysis': { 'publishers_mentioned': list(all_publishers_mentioned), 'publisher_frequency': publisher_frequency, 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'extremely_high_priority_count': len([f for f in high_priority_findings if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in f['priority']]), 'library_results_count': len(library_results) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings[:15], # Top 15 findings 'library_results': library_results, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'known_publishers_checked': known_publishers_1870s, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/martineau_1877_1878_four_volume_publisher_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** 1877-1878 FOUR-VOLUME EDITION PUBLISHER SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'‚úì Conducted {successful_searches} successful web searches') print(f'‚úì Analyzed {sum(len(r["relevant_links"]) for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(all_publishers_mentioned)} unique publishers mentioned') print(f'‚úì Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'‚úì Conducted {len(library_search_queries)} library catalog searches') print(f'‚úì Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\nüéØ MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Publishers mentioned: {top_finding["publishers_mentioned"]}') print(f'Score: {top_finding["score"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') # Check if we have a definitive answer extremely_high_findings = [f for f in high_priority_findings if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in f['priority']] if extremely_high_findings and extremely_high_findings[0]['publishers_mentioned']: top_publisher = extremely_high_findings[0]['publishers_mentioned'][0] print(f'\nüèÜ LIKELY PUBLISHER: {top_publisher}') print('This finding contains 1877/1878 + four volumes + publisher information') else: print(f'\n‚ö† No definitive publisher identified in searches') print('The 1877-1878 four-volume edition may be rare or from a smaller publisher') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS FOR VERIFICATION ===') print('1. Review extremely high priority findings for definitive publisher identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Check saved WorldCat search results for bibliographic details') print('4. Cross-reference with HathiTrust or Internet Archive') print('5. Consult specialized 19th century British publishing histories') print('6. Check university library rare book catalogs')

2025-08-13 00:40:09
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code has a critical syntax error that prevents it from running at all. There's an unterminated string literal at line 76 in the filename generation code, caused by conflicting quote marks in the f-string. However, the **CURRENT CODE OUTPUT** shows confusing mixed output that appears to be from a completely different program about Colombian volcanic disasters and archbishops, not the Martineau publisher search. This suggests there may be an execution environment issue or code contamination. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no Martineau publisher search was actually executed. The code needs the quote escaping issue fixed first. Recommended fix: Replace the problematic filename generation line with a simpler approach like `clean_query = re.sub(r'[^a-zA-Z0-9_]', '_', query)[:50]` and `filename = f'martineau_1877_search_{search_index:02d}_{clean_query}.html'` to avoid complex string replacement conflicts.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus import re print('=== SEARCHING FOR 1877-1878 FOUR-VOLUME EDITION PUBLISHER ===') print('Title: The History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace: 1816-1846') print('Author: Harriet Martineau') print('Target: 1877-1878 four-volume edition publisher') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for the 1877-1878 four-volume edition search_queries = [ 'Harriet Martineau "History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" 1877 1878 four volumes publisher', 'Martineau 1877 1878 edition "History England Thirty Years Peace" publisher', '"History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" Martineau 1877 four volume', 'Harriet Martineau 1877 1878 "Thirty Years Peace" four volumes', 'Martineau "History England" 1877 1878 four volume edition publisher', '"Thirty Years Peace 1816-1846" Martineau 1877 1878 publisher', 'Harriet Martineau 1877 four volume History England publisher', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Macmillan', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Longmans', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Smith Elder' ] # Known 19th century publishers who commonly produced multi-volume historical works known_publishers_1870s = [ 'Macmillan', 'Macmillan and Co', 'Macmillan & Co', 'Longmans', 'Longmans Green', 'Longmans, Green, and Co', 'Smith Elder', 'Smith, Elder & Co', 'Smith, Elder and Co', 'George Routledge', 'Routledge', 'George Routledge and Sons', 'John Murray', 'Murray', 'Chapman and Hall', 'Chapman & Hall', 'Blackwood', 'William Blackwood', 'Blackwood and Sons', 'Cassell', 'Cassell & Company', 'Cassell, Petter & Galpin', 'Ward Lock', 'Ward, Lock & Co', 'Frederick Warne', 'Sampson Low', 'Sampson Low, Marston', 'Henry S. King', 'Kegan Paul', 'Kegan Paul, Trench & Co', 'Rivingtons' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR 1877-1878 EDITION ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') search_results = {} # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Cache-Control': 'no-cache' } # Function to perform search and analyze results - FIXED QUOTE ESCAPING ISSUE def perform_search(query, search_index): search_base_url = 'https://html.duckduckgo.com/html/' print(f'\n--- SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: params = {'q': query} response = requests.get(search_base_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save raw HTML for analysis - FIXED filename generation to avoid quote conflicts clean_query = query.replace(' ', '_').replace('"', '').replace("'", '').replace(':', '').replace('?', '') filename = f'martineau_1877_search_{search_index:02d}_{clean_query[:50]}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Parse for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links with publisher information result_links = [] for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') text = link.get_text().strip() # Filter for highly relevant results if href and text and len(text) > 15: text_lower = text.lower() relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for 1877-1878 four-volume edition high_value_terms = [ ('1877', 4), ('1878', 4), ('four volume', 3), ('four volumes', 3), ('4 volume', 3), ('4 volumes', 3), ('martineau', 3), ('history of england', 2), ('thirty years peace', 2), ('1816-1846', 2), ('1816 1846', 2), ('publisher', 2), ('published', 2), ('edition', 2), ('reprint', 2) ] # Publisher-specific terms with higher scores for known 1870s publishers publisher_terms = [] for pub in known_publishers_1870s: publisher_terms.append((pub.lower(), 4)) # Calculate relevance score for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_terms: if term in text_lower: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'hathitrust.org', 'archive.org', 'books.google.com']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['amazon.com', 'abebooks.com', 'goodreads.com']): relevance_score += 2 if relevance_score >= 4: # Only include highly relevant results result_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': text[:400], # Longer text for better analysis 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) # Sort by relevance score result_links.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'html_file': filepath, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'relevant_links': result_links[:20], # Top 20 most relevant 'total_links_found': len(result_links) } print(f'Found {len(result_links)} highly relevant links') if result_links: print('Top results:') for i, link in enumerate(result_links[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {link["relevance_score"]}: {link["text"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting return True else: print(f'Failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') return False except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') return False # Perform all searches print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES ===') successful_searches = 0 for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): if perform_search(query, i): successful_searches += 1 # Brief pause between searches if i < len(search_queries): time.sleep(1) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR 1877-1878 PUBLISHER ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') # Compile and analyze all findings high_priority_findings = [] all_publishers_mentioned = set() publisher_frequency = {} print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR 1877-1878 PUBLISHER PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant links: {results["total_links_found"]}') for link in results['relevant_links']: # Check for 1877/1878 and publisher combinations text_lower = link['text'].lower() # Check for year mentions (1877 or 1878) has_target_years = any(year in text_lower for year in ['1877', '1878']) # Check for four-volume mentions has_four_volumes = any(term in text_lower for term in ['four volume', 'four volumes', '4 volume', '4 volumes', 'vol. i', 'vol. ii', 'vol. iii', 'vol. iv']) if has_target_years and any(pub.lower() in text_lower for pub in known_publishers_1870s): # This is a high-priority finding matching_publishers = [pub for pub in known_publishers_1870s if pub.lower() in text_lower] priority_level = 'VERY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Publisher' if has_four_volumes: priority_level = 'EXTREMELY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Four Volumes + Publisher' high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'publishers_mentioned': matching_publishers, 'priority': priority_level, 'has_target_years': has_target_years, 'has_four_volumes': has_four_volumes }) # Track publisher frequency for pub in matching_publishers: publisher_frequency[pub] = publisher_frequency.get(pub, 0) + 1 all_publishers_mentioned.add(pub) print(f' üéØ {priority_level}: {matching_publishers}') elif has_target_years: # Contains 1877/1878 but may have publisher info we need to extract priority_level = 'HIGH - Contains 1877/1878' if has_four_volumes: priority_level = 'VERY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Four Volumes' high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'publishers_mentioned': [], 'priority': priority_level, 'has_target_years': has_target_years, 'has_four_volumes': has_four_volumes }) print(f' üìç {priority_level}') # Track any publisher mentions regardless of year for pub in known_publishers_1870s: if pub.lower() in text_lower: all_publishers_mentioned.add(pub) publisher_frequency[pub] = publisher_frequency.get(pub, 0) + 1 print(f'\n=== STEP 3: PUBLISHER FREQUENCY ANALYSIS ===') print(f'Total unique publishers mentioned: {len(all_publishers_mentioned)}') print(f'High-priority findings (1877/1878 + publisher): {len([f for f in high_priority_findings if "publisher" in f["priority"].lower()])}') if publisher_frequency: print('\nPublisher mention frequency:') sorted_publishers = sorted(publisher_frequency.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for pub, count in sorted_publishers: print(f' {pub}: {count} mentions') else: print('\nNo specific publishers identified in search results') print(f'\n=== STEP 4: DETAILED ANALYSIS OF HIGH-PRIORITY FINDINGS ===') if high_priority_findings: # Sort by priority and score priority_order = { 'EXTREMELY HIGH': 5, 'VERY HIGH': 4, 'HIGH': 3, 'MEDIUM': 2, 'LOW': 1 } def get_priority_score(finding): priority = finding['priority'] for key, score in priority_order.items(): if key in priority: return score return 0 high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (get_priority_score(x), x['score']), reverse=True) print(f'\nAnalyzing {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings:') for i, finding in enumerate(high_priority_findings[:15], 1): # Top 15 findings print(f'\nüîç FINDING {i} - {finding["priority"]} (Score: {finding["score"]})') print(f'Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f'Publishers: {finding["publishers_mentioned"] if finding["publishers_mentioned"] else "None explicitly identified"}') print(f'Has 1877/1878: {finding["has_target_years"]}') print(f'Has four volumes: {finding["has_four_volumes"]}') print(f'URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f'Text: {finding["text"][:500]}...') print('-' * 120) # If this is an extremely high priority finding, mark for investigation if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in finding['priority']: print(f' ‚≠ê CRITICAL FOR INVESTIGATION: {finding["url"]}') else: print('\n‚ö† No high-priority findings identified') print('This suggests the 1877-1878 four-volume edition may be rare or from a smaller publisher') print(f'\n=== STEP 5: SEARCHING SPECIFIC LIBRARY CATALOGS ===') # Try to search WorldCat and HathiTrust specifically library_search_queries = [ 'Martineau "History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" 1877', 'Harriet Martineau "Thirty Years Peace" 1877 1878 four volumes', 'Martineau "History England" 1877 four volume' ] library_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(library_search_queries, 1): print(f'\n--- LIBRARY CATALOG SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') # Try WorldCat search try: worldcat_url = f'https://www.worldcat.org/search?q={quote_plus(query)}&qt=results_page' response = requests.get(worldcat_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'WorldCat Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save WorldCat response filename = f'worldcat_martineau_1877_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved WorldCat: {filepath}') # Parse for bibliographic information soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for publication information text_content = soup.get_text().lower() # Check for 1877/1878 and publisher information if ('1877' in text_content or '1878' in text_content) and 'martineau' in text_content: print('‚úì Found relevant WorldCat entries with 1877/1878 + Martineau') # Look for publisher information in the text for pub in known_publishers_1870s: if pub.lower() in text_content: print(f' üìö PUBLISHER FOUND IN WORLDCAT: {pub}') library_results.append({ 'source': 'WorldCat', 'query': query, 'publisher': pub, 'file': filepath }) else: print('- No relevant 1877/1878 Martineau entries found') time.sleep(3) # Longer pause for library catalogs except Exception as e: print(f'Error with WorldCat search: {str(e)}') print(f'\n=== STEP 6: ANALYZING EXISTING WORKSPACE FILES ===') # Check if there are any existing files that might contain relevant information workspace_files = [f for f in os.listdir('workspace') if f.endswith('.html') or f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} existing files to analyze') # Look for files that might contain 1877/1878 or Martineau information relevant_existing_files = [] for filename in workspace_files: filename_lower = filename.lower() if any(term in filename_lower for term in ['martineau', '1877', '1878', 'history', 'england']): relevant_existing_files.append(filename) if relevant_existing_files: print(f'\nFound {len(relevant_existing_files)} potentially relevant existing files:') for filename in relevant_existing_files[:10]: # Check first 10 files print(f'\n--- ANALYZING EXISTING FILE: {filename} ---') filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read().lower() # Check for 1877/1878 and publisher information has_1877_1878 = '1877' in content or '1878' in content has_martineau = 'martineau' in content has_history_england = 'history of england' in content or 'thirty years peace' in content if has_1877_1878 and has_martineau: print(f'‚úì Contains 1877/1878 + Martineau') # Look for publisher information found_publishers = [] for pub in known_publishers_1870s: if pub.lower() in content: found_publishers.append(pub) if found_publishers: print(f' üìö PUBLISHERS FOUND: {found_publishers}') # Try to find specific context around 1877/1878 and publishers if filename.endswith('.html'): soup = BeautifulSoup(content, 'html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() else: text_content = content # Find sentences containing both year and publisher lines = text_content.split('\n') for line in lines: line_lower = line.lower() if ('1877' in line_lower or '1878' in line_lower) and any(pub.lower() in line_lower for pub in found_publishers): matching_pubs = [pub for pub in found_publishers if pub.lower() in line_lower] print(f' üéØ CONTEXT: {matching_pubs[0]} - {line.strip()[:200]}...') break else: print(' - No known publishers found') else: print('- Not relevant (missing 1877/1878 or Martineau)') except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading {filename}: {str(e)}') else: print('\nNo relevant existing files found') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Identify publisher of 1877-1878 four-volume edition of Martineau\'s History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace', 'book_details': { 'title': 'The History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace: 1816-1846', 'author': 'Harriet Martineau', 'target_edition': '1877-1878 four-volume edition', 'period_covered': '1816-1846' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(r['relevant_links']) for r in search_results.values()), 'library_catalog_searches': len(library_search_queries) }, 'publisher_analysis': { 'publishers_mentioned': list(all_publishers_mentioned), 'publisher_frequency': publisher_frequency, 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'extremely_high_priority_count': len([f for f in high_priority_findings if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in f['priority']]), 'library_results_count': len(library_results) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings[:15], # Top 15 findings 'library_results': library_results, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'known_publishers_checked': known_publishers_1870s, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/martineau_1877_1878_four_volume_publisher_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** 1877-1878 FOUR-VOLUME EDITION PUBLISHER SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'‚úì Conducted {successful_searches} successful web searches') print(f'‚úì Analyzed {sum(len(r["relevant_links"]) for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(all_publishers_mentioned)} unique publishers mentioned') print(f'‚úì Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'‚úì Conducted {len(library_search_queries)} library catalog searches') print(f'‚úì Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\nüéØ MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Publishers mentioned: {top_finding["publishers_mentioned"]}') print(f'Score: {top_finding["score"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') # Check if we have a definitive answer extremely_high_findings = [f for f in high_priority_findings if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in f['priority']] if extremely_high_findings and extremely_high_findings[0]['publishers_mentioned']: top_publisher = extremely_high_findings[0]['publishers_mentioned'][0] print(f'\nüèÜ LIKELY PUBLISHER: {top_publisher}') print('This finding contains 1877/1878 + four volumes + publisher information') else: print(f'\n‚ö† No definitive publisher identified in searches') print('The 1877-1878 four-volume edition may be rare or from a smaller publisher') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS FOR VERIFICATION ===') print('1. Review extremely high priority findings for definitive publisher identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Check saved WorldCat search results for bibliographic details') print('4. Cross-reference with HathiTrust or Internet Archive') print('5. Consult specialized 19th century British publishing histories') print('6. Check university library rare book catalogs')
Execution Output

developer
2025-08-13 00:42:25
Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus import re print('=== SEARCHING FOR 1877-1878 FOUR-VOLUME EDITION PUBLISHER ===') print('Title: The History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace: 1816-1846') print('Author: Harriet Martineau') print('Target: 1877-1878 four-volume edition publisher') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for the 1877-1878 four-volume edition search_queries = [ 'Harriet Martineau "History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" 1877 1878 four volumes publisher', 'Martineau 1877 1878 edition "History England Thirty Years Peace" publisher', '"History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" Martineau 1877 four volume', 'Harriet Martineau 1877 1878 "Thirty Years Peace" four volumes', 'Martineau "History England" 1877 1878 four volume edition publisher', '"Thirty Years Peace 1816-1846" Martineau 1877 1878 publisher', 'Harriet Martineau 1877 four volume History England publisher', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Macmillan', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Longmans', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Smith Elder' ] # Known 19th century publishers who commonly produced multi-volume historical works known_publishers_1870s = [ 'Macmillan', 'Macmillan and Co', 'Macmillan & Co', 'Longmans', 'Longmans Green', 'Longmans, Green, and Co', 'Smith Elder', 'Smith, Elder & Co', 'Smith, Elder and Co', 'George Routledge', 'Routledge', 'George Routledge and Sons', 'John Murray', 'Murray', 'Chapman and Hall', 'Chapman & Hall', 'Blackwood', 'William Blackwood', 'Blackwood and Sons', 'Cassell', 'Cassell & Company', 'Cassell, Petter & Galpin', 'Ward Lock', 'Ward, Lock & Co', 'Frederick Warne', 'Sampson Low', 'Sampson Low, Marston', 'Henry S. King', 'Kegan Paul', 'Kegan Paul, Trench & Co', 'Rivingtons' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR 1877-1878 EDITION ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results - FIXED ALL ISSUES def perform_search(query, search_index): # Define headers inside function to fix scope issue headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Cache-Control': 'no-cache' } search_base_url = 'https://html.duckduckgo.com/html/' print(f'\n--- SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: params = {'q': query} response = requests.get(search_base_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save raw HTML for analysis - FIXED filename generation using regex clean_query = re.sub(r'[^a-zA-Z0-9_]', '_', query)[:50] filename = f'martineau_1877_search_{search_index:02d}_{clean_query}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Parse for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links with publisher information result_links = [] for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') text = link.get_text().strip() # Filter for highly relevant results if href and text and len(text) > 15: text_lower = text.lower() relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for 1877-1878 four-volume edition high_value_terms = [ ('1877', 4), ('1878', 4), ('four volume', 3), ('four volumes', 3), ('4 volume', 3), ('4 volumes', 3), ('martineau', 3), ('history of england', 2), ('thirty years peace', 2), ('1816-1846', 2), ('1816 1846', 2), ('publisher', 2), ('published', 2), ('edition', 2), ('reprint', 2) ] # Publisher-specific terms with higher scores for known 1870s publishers publisher_terms = [] for pub in known_publishers_1870s: publisher_terms.append((pub.lower(), 4)) # Calculate relevance score for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_terms: if term in text_lower: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'hathitrust.org', 'archive.org', 'books.google.com']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['amazon.com', 'abebooks.com', 'goodreads.com']): relevance_score += 2 if relevance_score >= 4: # Only include highly relevant results result_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': text[:400], # Longer text for better analysis 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) # Sort by relevance score result_links.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'html_file': filepath, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'relevant_links': result_links[:20], # Top 20 most relevant 'total_links_found': len(result_links) } print(f'Found {len(result_links)} highly relevant links') if result_links: print('Top results:') for i, link in enumerate(result_links[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {link["relevance_score"]}: {link["text"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting return True else: print(f'Failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') return False except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') return False # Perform all searches print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES ===') successful_searches = 0 for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): if perform_search(query, i): successful_searches += 1 # Brief pause between searches if i < len(search_queries): time.sleep(1) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR 1877-1878 PUBLISHER ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') # Compile and analyze all findings high_priority_findings = [] all_publishers_mentioned = set() publisher_frequency = {} print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR 1877-1878 PUBLISHER PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant links: {results["total_links_found"]}') for link in results['relevant_links']: # Check for 1877/1878 and publisher combinations text_lower = link['text'].lower() # Check for year mentions (1877 or 1878) has_target_years = any(year in text_lower for year in ['1877', '1878']) # Check for four-volume mentions has_four_volumes = any(term in text_lower for term in ['four volume', 'four volumes', '4 volume', '4 volumes', 'vol. i', 'vol. ii', 'vol. iii', 'vol. iv']) if has_target_years and any(pub.lower() in text_lower for pub in known_publishers_1870s): # This is a high-priority finding matching_publishers = [pub for pub in known_publishers_1870s if pub.lower() in text_lower] priority_level = 'VERY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Publisher' if has_four_volumes: priority_level = 'EXTREMELY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Four Volumes + Publisher' high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'publishers_mentioned': matching_publishers, 'priority': priority_level, 'has_target_years': has_target_years, 'has_four_volumes': has_four_volumes }) # Track publisher frequency for pub in matching_publishers: publisher_frequency[pub] = publisher_frequency.get(pub, 0) + 1 all_publishers_mentioned.add(pub) print(f' üéØ {priority_level}: {matching_publishers}') elif has_target_years: # Contains 1877/1878 but may have publisher info we need to extract priority_level = 'HIGH - Contains 1877/1878' if has_four_volumes: priority_level = 'VERY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Four Volumes' high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'publishers_mentioned': [], 'priority': priority_level, 'has_target_years': has_target_years, 'has_four_volumes': has_four_volumes }) print(f' üìç {priority_level}') # Track any publisher mentions regardless of year for pub in known_publishers_1870s: if pub.lower() in text_lower: all_publishers_mentioned.add(pub) publisher_frequency[pub] = publisher_frequency.get(pub, 0) + 1 print(f'\n=== STEP 3: PUBLISHER FREQUENCY ANALYSIS ===') print(f'Total unique publishers mentioned: {len(all_publishers_mentioned)}') print(f'High-priority findings (1877/1878 + publisher): {len([f for f in high_priority_findings if "publisher" in f["priority"].lower()])}') if publisher_frequency: print('\nPublisher mention frequency:') sorted_publishers = sorted(publisher_frequency.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for pub, count in sorted_publishers: print(f' {pub}: {count} mentions') else: print('\nNo specific publishers identified in search results') print(f'\n=== STEP 4: DETAILED ANALYSIS OF HIGH-PRIORITY FINDINGS ===') if high_priority_findings: # Sort by priority and score priority_order = { 'EXTREMELY HIGH': 5, 'VERY HIGH': 4, 'HIGH': 3, 'MEDIUM': 2, 'LOW': 1 } def get_priority_score(finding): priority = finding['priority'] for key, score in priority_order.items(): if key in priority: return score return 0 high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (get_priority_score(x), x['score']), reverse=True) print(f'\nAnalyzing {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings:') for i, finding in enumerate(high_priority_findings[:15], 1): # Top 15 findings print(f'\nüîç FINDING {i} - {finding["priority"]} (Score: {finding["score"]})') print(f'Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f'Publishers: {finding["publishers_mentioned"] if finding["publishers_mentioned"] else "None explicitly identified"}') print(f'Has 1877/1878: {finding["has_target_years"]}') print(f'Has four volumes: {finding["has_four_volumes"]}') print(f'URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f'Text: {finding["text"][:500]}...') print('-' * 120) # If this is an extremely high priority finding, mark for investigation if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in finding['priority']: print(f' ‚≠ê CRITICAL FOR INVESTIGATION: {finding["url"]}') else: print('\n‚ö† No high-priority findings identified') print('This suggests the 1877-1878 four-volume edition may be rare or from a smaller publisher') print(f'\n=== STEP 5: SEARCHING SPECIFIC LIBRARY CATALOGS ===') # Try to search WorldCat specifically library_search_queries = [ 'Martineau "History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" 1877', 'Harriet Martineau "Thirty Years Peace" 1877 1878 four volumes', 'Martineau "History England" 1877 four volume' ] library_results = [] # Define headers for library searches library_headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } for i, query in enumerate(library_search_queries, 1): print(f'\n--- LIBRARY CATALOG SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') # Try WorldCat search try: worldcat_url = f'https://www.worldcat.org/search?q={quote_plus(query)}&qt=results_page' response = requests.get(worldcat_url, headers=library_headers, timeout=30) print(f'WorldCat Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save WorldCat response filename = f'worldcat_martineau_1877_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved WorldCat: {filepath}') # Parse for bibliographic information soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for publication information text_content = soup.get_text().lower() # Check for 1877/1878 and publisher information if ('1877' in text_content or '1878' in text_content) and 'martineau' in text_content: print('‚úì Found relevant WorldCat entries with 1877/1878 + Martineau') # Look for publisher information in the text for pub in known_publishers_1870s: if pub.lower() in text_content: print(f' üìö PUBLISHER FOUND IN WORLDCAT: {pub}') library_results.append({ 'source': 'WorldCat', 'query': query, 'publisher': pub, 'file': filepath }) else: print('- No relevant 1877/1878 Martineau entries found') time.sleep(3) # Longer pause for library catalogs except Exception as e: print(f'Error with WorldCat search: {str(e)}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Identify publisher of 1877-1878 four-volume edition of Martineau\'s History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace', 'book_details': { 'title': 'The History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace: 1816-1846', 'author': 'Harriet Martineau', 'target_edition': '1877-1878 four-volume edition', 'period_covered': '1816-1846' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(r['relevant_links']) for r in search_results.values()), 'library_catalog_searches': len(library_search_queries) }, 'publisher_analysis': { 'publishers_mentioned': list(all_publishers_mentioned), 'publisher_frequency': publisher_frequency, 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'extremely_high_priority_count': len([f for f in high_priority_findings if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in f['priority']]), 'library_results_count': len(library_results) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings[:15], # Top 15 findings 'library_results': library_results, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'known_publishers_checked': known_publishers_1870s, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/martineau_1877_1878_four_volume_publisher_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** 1877-1878 FOUR-VOLUME EDITION PUBLISHER SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'‚úì Conducted {successful_searches} successful web searches') print(f'‚úì Analyzed {sum(len(r["relevant_links"]) for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(all_publishers_mentioned)} unique publishers mentioned') print(f'‚úì Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'‚úì Conducted {len(library_search_queries)} library catalog searches') print(f'‚úì Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\nüéØ MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Publishers mentioned: {top_finding["publishers_mentioned"]}') print(f'Score: {top_finding["score"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') # Check if we have a definitive answer extremely_high_findings = [f for f in high_priority_findings if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in f['priority']] if extremely_high_findings and extremely_high_findings[0]['publishers_mentioned']: top_publisher = extremely_high_findings[0]['publishers_mentioned'][0] print(f'\nüèÜ LIKELY PUBLISHER: {top_publisher}') print('This finding contains 1877/1878 + four volumes + publisher information') else: print(f'\n‚ö† No definitive publisher identified in searches') print('The 1877-1878 four-volume edition may be rare or from a smaller publisher') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS FOR VERIFICATION ===') print('1. Review extremely high priority findings for definitive publisher identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Check saved WorldCat search results for bibliographic details') print('4. Cross-reference with HathiTrust or Internet Archive') print('5. Consult specialized 19th century British publishing histories') print('6. Check university library rare book catalogs')
Execution Output

tester
2025-08-13 00:42:26
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - There are two critical issues preventing the code from working: (1) BeautifulSoup import error: 'BeautifulSoup' is not defined, which occurs when trying to parse HTML responses from web searches, and (2) Scope issue with 'headers' variable not being defined inside the perform_search function. The code successfully made HTTP requests (status 200 for first 2 searches, status 202 for others), saved HTML files, and completed 3 WorldCat library catalog searches, but failed to parse any results due to the BeautifulSoup error. **PLAN** alignment: 30% - basic search execution worked but no analysis was completed due to parsing failures. The output shows 0 successful searches, 0 publishers identified, and 0 high-priority findings. Recommended fixes: (1) Move the headers definition inside the perform_search function or define library_headers separately, and (2) Add proper error handling for BeautifulSoup parsing. The WorldCat searches did find relevant 1877/1878 Martineau entries, so the saved HTML files may contain useful data for manual review.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus import re print('=== SEARCHING FOR 1877-1878 FOUR-VOLUME EDITION PUBLISHER ===') print('Title: The History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace: 1816-1846') print('Author: Harriet Martineau') print('Target: 1877-1878 four-volume edition publisher') print('\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define comprehensive search queries for the 1877-1878 four-volume edition search_queries = [ 'Harriet Martineau "History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" 1877 1878 four volumes publisher', 'Martineau 1877 1878 edition "History England Thirty Years Peace" publisher', '"History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" Martineau 1877 four volume', 'Harriet Martineau 1877 1878 "Thirty Years Peace" four volumes', 'Martineau "History England" 1877 1878 four volume edition publisher', '"Thirty Years Peace 1816-1846" Martineau 1877 1878 publisher', 'Harriet Martineau 1877 four volume History England publisher', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Macmillan', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Longmans', 'Martineau "History of England" 1877 1878 four volumes Smith Elder' ] # Known 19th century publishers who commonly produced multi-volume historical works known_publishers_1870s = [ 'Macmillan', 'Macmillan and Co', 'Macmillan & Co', 'Longmans', 'Longmans Green', 'Longmans, Green, and Co', 'Smith Elder', 'Smith, Elder & Co', 'Smith, Elder and Co', 'George Routledge', 'Routledge', 'George Routledge and Sons', 'John Murray', 'Murray', 'Chapman and Hall', 'Chapman & Hall', 'Blackwood', 'William Blackwood', 'Blackwood and Sons', 'Cassell', 'Cassell & Company', 'Cassell, Petter & Galpin', 'Ward Lock', 'Ward, Lock & Co', 'Frederick Warne', 'Sampson Low', 'Sampson Low, Marston', 'Henry S. King', 'Kegan Paul', 'Kegan Paul, Trench & Co', 'Rivingtons' ] print('=== STEP 1: CONDUCTING TARGETED SEARCHES FOR 1877-1878 EDITION ===') print(f'Total search queries: {len(search_queries)}') print('\nSearch queries:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i:2d}. {query}') search_results = {} # Function to perform search and analyze results - FIXED ALL ISSUES def perform_search(query, search_index): # Define headers inside function to fix scope issue headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Cache-Control': 'no-cache' } search_base_url = 'https://html.duckduckgo.com/html/' print(f'\n--- SEARCH {search_index}: {query} ---') try: params = {'q': query} response = requests.get(search_base_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save raw HTML for analysis - FIXED filename generation using regex clean_query = re.sub(r'[^a-zA-Z0-9_]', '_', query)[:50] filename = f'martineau_1877_search_{search_index:02d}_{clean_query}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Parse for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links with publisher information result_links = [] for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') text = link.get_text().strip() # Filter for highly relevant results if href and text and len(text) > 15: text_lower = text.lower() relevance_score = 0 # High-value terms for 1877-1878 four-volume edition high_value_terms = [ ('1877', 4), ('1878', 4), ('four volume', 3), ('four volumes', 3), ('4 volume', 3), ('4 volumes', 3), ('martineau', 3), ('history of england', 2), ('thirty years peace', 2), ('1816-1846', 2), ('1816 1846', 2), ('publisher', 2), ('published', 2), ('edition', 2), ('reprint', 2) ] # Publisher-specific terms with higher scores for known 1870s publishers publisher_terms = [] for pub in known_publishers_1870s: publisher_terms.append((pub.lower(), 4)) # Calculate relevance score for term, score in high_value_terms + publisher_terms: if term in text_lower: relevance_score += score # Additional scoring for URL domains if href: href_lower = href.lower() if any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['worldcat.org', 'hathitrust.org', 'archive.org', 'books.google.com']): relevance_score += 3 elif any(domain in href_lower for domain in ['amazon.com', 'abebooks.com', 'goodreads.com']): relevance_score += 2 if relevance_score >= 4: # Only include highly relevant results result_links.append({ 'url': href, 'text': text[:400], # Longer text for better analysis 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) # Sort by relevance score result_links.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) search_results[query] = { 'html_file': filepath, 'status_code': response.status_code, 'relevant_links': result_links[:20], # Top 20 most relevant 'total_links_found': len(result_links) } print(f'Found {len(result_links)} highly relevant links') if result_links: print('Top results:') for i, link in enumerate(result_links[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. Score {link["relevance_score"]}: {link["text"][:150]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') time.sleep(2) # Rate limiting return True else: print(f'Failed: HTTP {response.status_code}') return False except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') return False # Perform all searches print('\n=== EXECUTING SEARCHES ===') successful_searches = 0 for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): if perform_search(query, i): successful_searches += 1 # Brief pause between searches if i < len(search_queries): time.sleep(1) print(f'\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING SEARCH RESULTS FOR 1877-1878 PUBLISHER ===') print(f'Successful searches: {successful_searches}/{len(search_queries)}') # Compile and analyze all findings high_priority_findings = [] all_publishers_mentioned = set() publisher_frequency = {} print('\n--- ANALYZING ALL SEARCH RESULTS FOR 1877-1878 PUBLISHER PATTERNS ---') for query, results in search_results.items(): print(f'\nQuery: "{query}"') print(f' Relevant links: {results["total_links_found"]}') for link in results['relevant_links']: # Check for 1877/1878 and publisher combinations text_lower = link['text'].lower() # Check for year mentions (1877 or 1878) has_target_years = any(year in text_lower for year in ['1877', '1878']) # Check for four-volume mentions has_four_volumes = any(term in text_lower for term in ['four volume', 'four volumes', '4 volume', '4 volumes', 'vol. i', 'vol. ii', 'vol. iii', 'vol. iv']) if has_target_years and any(pub.lower() in text_lower for pub in known_publishers_1870s): # This is a high-priority finding matching_publishers = [pub for pub in known_publishers_1870s if pub.lower() in text_lower] priority_level = 'VERY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Publisher' if has_four_volumes: priority_level = 'EXTREMELY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Four Volumes + Publisher' high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'publishers_mentioned': matching_publishers, 'priority': priority_level, 'has_target_years': has_target_years, 'has_four_volumes': has_four_volumes }) # Track publisher frequency for pub in matching_publishers: publisher_frequency[pub] = publisher_frequency.get(pub, 0) + 1 all_publishers_mentioned.add(pub) print(f' üéØ {priority_level}: {matching_publishers}') elif has_target_years: # Contains 1877/1878 but may have publisher info we need to extract priority_level = 'HIGH - Contains 1877/1878' if has_four_volumes: priority_level = 'VERY HIGH - Contains 1877/1878 + Four Volumes' high_priority_findings.append({ 'query': query, 'text': link['text'], 'url': link['url'], 'score': link['relevance_score'], 'publishers_mentioned': [], 'priority': priority_level, 'has_target_years': has_target_years, 'has_four_volumes': has_four_volumes }) print(f' üìç {priority_level}') # Track any publisher mentions regardless of year for pub in known_publishers_1870s: if pub.lower() in text_lower: all_publishers_mentioned.add(pub) publisher_frequency[pub] = publisher_frequency.get(pub, 0) + 1 print(f'\n=== STEP 3: PUBLISHER FREQUENCY ANALYSIS ===') print(f'Total unique publishers mentioned: {len(all_publishers_mentioned)}') print(f'High-priority findings (1877/1878 + publisher): {len([f for f in high_priority_findings if "publisher" in f["priority"].lower()])}') if publisher_frequency: print('\nPublisher mention frequency:') sorted_publishers = sorted(publisher_frequency.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True) for pub, count in sorted_publishers: print(f' {pub}: {count} mentions') else: print('\nNo specific publishers identified in search results') print(f'\n=== STEP 4: DETAILED ANALYSIS OF HIGH-PRIORITY FINDINGS ===') if high_priority_findings: # Sort by priority and score priority_order = { 'EXTREMELY HIGH': 5, 'VERY HIGH': 4, 'HIGH': 3, 'MEDIUM': 2, 'LOW': 1 } def get_priority_score(finding): priority = finding['priority'] for key, score in priority_order.items(): if key in priority: return score return 0 high_priority_findings.sort(key=lambda x: (get_priority_score(x), x['score']), reverse=True) print(f'\nAnalyzing {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings:') for i, finding in enumerate(high_priority_findings[:15], 1): # Top 15 findings print(f'\nüîç FINDING {i} - {finding["priority"]} (Score: {finding["score"]})') print(f'Query: {finding["query"]}') print(f'Publishers: {finding["publishers_mentioned"] if finding["publishers_mentioned"] else "None explicitly identified"}') print(f'Has 1877/1878: {finding["has_target_years"]}') print(f'Has four volumes: {finding["has_four_volumes"]}') print(f'URL: {finding["url"]}') print(f'Text: {finding["text"][:500]}...') print('-' * 120) # If this is an extremely high priority finding, mark for investigation if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in finding['priority']: print(f' ‚≠ê CRITICAL FOR INVESTIGATION: {finding["url"]}') else: print('\n‚ö† No high-priority findings identified') print('This suggests the 1877-1878 four-volume edition may be rare or from a smaller publisher') print(f'\n=== STEP 5: SEARCHING SPECIFIC LIBRARY CATALOGS ===') # Try to search WorldCat specifically library_search_queries = [ 'Martineau "History of England During the Thirty Years Peace" 1877', 'Harriet Martineau "Thirty Years Peace" 1877 1878 four volumes', 'Martineau "History England" 1877 four volume' ] library_results = [] # Define headers for library searches library_headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } for i, query in enumerate(library_search_queries, 1): print(f'\n--- LIBRARY CATALOG SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') # Try WorldCat search try: worldcat_url = f'https://www.worldcat.org/search?q={quote_plus(query)}&qt=results_page' response = requests.get(worldcat_url, headers=library_headers, timeout=30) print(f'WorldCat Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save WorldCat response filename = f'worldcat_martineau_1877_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved WorldCat: {filepath}') # Parse for bibliographic information soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for publication information text_content = soup.get_text().lower() # Check for 1877/1878 and publisher information if ('1877' in text_content or '1878' in text_content) and 'martineau' in text_content: print('‚úì Found relevant WorldCat entries with 1877/1878 + Martineau') # Look for publisher information in the text for pub in known_publishers_1870s: if pub.lower() in text_content: print(f' üìö PUBLISHER FOUND IN WORLDCAT: {pub}') library_results.append({ 'source': 'WorldCat', 'query': query, 'publisher': pub, 'file': filepath }) else: print('- No relevant 1877/1878 Martineau entries found') time.sleep(3) # Longer pause for library catalogs except Exception as e: print(f'Error with WorldCat search: {str(e)}') # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_results = { 'search_objective': 'Identify publisher of 1877-1878 four-volume edition of Martineau\'s History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace', 'book_details': { 'title': 'The History of England During the Thirty Years\' Peace: 1816-1846', 'author': 'Harriet Martineau', 'target_edition': '1877-1878 four-volume edition', 'period_covered': '1816-1846' }, 'search_summary': { 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'successful_searches': successful_searches, 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(r['relevant_links']) for r in search_results.values()), 'library_catalog_searches': len(library_search_queries) }, 'publisher_analysis': { 'publishers_mentioned': list(all_publishers_mentioned), 'publisher_frequency': publisher_frequency, 'high_priority_findings_count': len(high_priority_findings), 'extremely_high_priority_count': len([f for f in high_priority_findings if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in f['priority']]), 'library_results_count': len(library_results) }, 'high_priority_findings': high_priority_findings[:15], # Top 15 findings 'library_results': library_results, 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'known_publishers_checked': known_publishers_1870s, 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } analysis_file = 'workspace/martineau_1877_1878_four_volume_publisher_search.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n*** 1877-1878 FOUR-VOLUME EDITION PUBLISHER SEARCH COMPLETE ***') print(f'‚úì Conducted {successful_searches} successful web searches') print(f'‚úì Analyzed {sum(len(r["relevant_links"]) for r in search_results.values())} relevant results') print(f'‚úì Identified {len(all_publishers_mentioned)} unique publishers mentioned') print(f'‚úì Found {len(high_priority_findings)} high-priority findings') print(f'‚úì Conducted {len(library_search_queries)} library catalog searches') print(f'‚úì Comprehensive analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Summary of most promising leads if high_priority_findings: top_finding = high_priority_findings[0] print(f'\nüéØ MOST PROMISING LEAD:') print(f'Priority: {top_finding["priority"]}') print(f'Publishers mentioned: {top_finding["publishers_mentioned"]}') print(f'Score: {top_finding["score"]}') print(f'URL: {top_finding["url"]}') # Check if we have a definitive answer extremely_high_findings = [f for f in high_priority_findings if 'EXTREMELY HIGH' in f['priority']] if extremely_high_findings and extremely_high_findings[0]['publishers_mentioned']: top_publisher = extremely_high_findings[0]['publishers_mentioned'][0] print(f'\nüèÜ LIKELY PUBLISHER: {top_publisher}') print('This finding contains 1877/1878 + four volumes + publisher information') else: print(f'\n‚ö† No definitive publisher identified in searches') print('The 1877-1878 four-volume edition may be rare or from a smaller publisher') print('\n=== NEXT STEPS FOR VERIFICATION ===') print('1. Review extremely high priority findings for definitive publisher identification') print('2. Investigate URLs from top-scoring results') print('3. Check saved WorldCat search results for bibliographic details') print('4. Cross-reference with HathiTrust or Internet Archive') print('5. Consult specialized 19th century British publishing histories') print('6. Check university library rare book catalogs')
